Method Detail

getPunchOutMessage

public PunchOutResultIf getPunchOutMessage(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                           OrderIf order,
                                           PunchOutOptionsIf options)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a punch out message from an order. The options parameter defines the standard used. Valid standards are:
  • com.konakart.app.PunchOutOptions.OCI_HTML - OCI standard using HTML messages
  • com.konakart.app.PunchOutOptions.OCI_XML - OCI standard using XML messages

Specified by:
getPunchOutMessage in interface PunchOutMgrIf
Parameters:
sessionId - Session Id of the customer.
order - Order used to create message
options - Options to configure the call by defining things such as the standard used for the message and the version of the standard.
Returns:
Returns the message used for the punch out in the form of a string (normally XML) or an array of name value pairs.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getPunchOutMessage_OCI_HTML

protected PunchOutResultIf getPunchOutMessage_OCI_HTML(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                                       OrderIf order,
                                                       PunchOutOptionsIf options)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Method used to create the punch out message when using the OCI_HTML standard

getData_OCI_HTML

protected void getData_OCI_HTML(OrderIf order,
                                OrderProductIf op,
                                java.util.List<NameValue> nvList,
                                int index,
                                int scale,
                                PunchOutOptionsIf options)
In your own implementation of the PunchOut manager you can override this method to customize the data being returned. The parameters are set using code similar to:
nvList.add(new NameValue("NEW_ITEM-DESCRIPTION[" + index + "]", op.getName()));

Parameters:
order - The order
op - The order product
nvList - List of NameValue pairs. New data is added to the list.
index - Index used for creating the name value pairs
scale - Scale used for formatting the currency
options - PunchOutOptions

getData_OCI_XML

protected java.lang.String getData_OCI_XML(java.lang.String tagName,
                                           java.lang.String attrName,
                                           OrderProductIf orderProduct,
                                           PunchOutOptionsIf options)
In your own implementation of the PunchOut manager you can override this method to provide your own data for the various tags and tag attributes.

Parameters:
tagName - The name of the tag as it appears in the XML
attrName - The name of the attribute as it appears in the XML
orderProduct - The OrderProduct object. In most cases it will have an attached Product object
options - The PunchOut options
Returns:
Returns the data that will be added to the message. Default values are used if null is returned
